title: Understanding SQL Joins
text: In SQL, joins are used to combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column between them. There are several types of joins, each serving a different purpose.

title: Types of Joins
text: The main types of joins in SQL are: Inner Join, Left Join, Right Join, and Full Join. Each type determines how the tables are combined and which records are included in the result set.

title: Left Join Definition
text: A Left Join returns all records from the left table and the matched records from the right table. If there is no match, the result is NULL on the side of the right table.
